title: London, BL, Add. 14594
works of Nonnus (ܢܐܢܘܣ, ܢܘܢܘܣ , ܢܘܢܐ), archdeacon of Nisibis

letter to a person unnamed, who asked him bow Christians were to prove to polytheists and infidels that God was One and not many; that this One was Three, and yet One and the Same; and that the Incarnation of God the Word, one of the holy Trinity, took place under a fitting conjunction of circumstances and as became the Deity.
controversial theological treatise, consisting of four discourses, composed by him, when in prison, against Thomas the Nestorian, metropolitan of Beth-Garmai.
letter to an anonymous correspondent, who propounded to him in a note (ܦܛܩܐ, πιτάκη, πιττάκιον) a question regarding the two natures in Christ
letter in reply to one from a monk named John
author: Nonnus of Nisibis
Nonnus of Nisibis
Nonnus of Nisibis

persName: Thomas, bishop of Marga and metropolitan of Beth-Garmai
decorations: On fol. 1a there is an effigy of Abbā Bīshōi or Pisoes, (sic) ܏ܩܕ ܐܒܐ ܒܫܝ, drawn by a person named Barṣaumā, ܐܢܐ ܒܪܨܘܡܐ ܨܪܬ.
otherLimit: ܫܘܐܠܐ. ܩܘܝ ܐܠܗܐ ܐܠܗܐ ܘܒܪܢܫܐ ܒܪܢܫܐ̣. ܐܘܒܕ ܐܠܗܐ ܡܕܡ̣. ܐܘܒܕ ܒܪܢܫܐ ܡܢܗ ܡܕܡ̣. ܘܐܝܟܢܐ ܡܕܝܢ ܠܘ ܬܪܝܢ ܟܝ̈ܢܝܢ܀
